definition: to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: Enterprise information for 20 years. Software(management) consulting soft-landing.
sentences.chinese: 企业信息化20年，软件咨询软着陆。

sentences.english: We foresee a soft landing, but this cannot be taken for granted.
sentences.chinese: 我们预期会出现软着陆，但不能将其视为理所当然。

sentences.english: This method may allow simple guidance with less complex sensors for low-cost soft landing on the lunar surface.
sentences.chinese: 这种制导方法测量简单，适于低成本的软着陆任务。

sentences.english: Look, we’ve had only one soft landing since the Second World War.
sentences.chinese: 二战后，我们的经济只有过一次成功的软着陆。

sentences.english: It remains to be seen whether China manages to execute an expected soft landing.
sentences.chinese: 中国能否设法实现预期的软着陆还有待观察。

sentences.english: A scheme of autonomous navigation and obstacle avoidance for probes landing on small body is developed.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一种小天体软着陆自主导航与障碍检测方法。

sentences.english: And in terms of overall economic growth, China is looking at a softish landing at worst.
sentences.chinese: 至于整体上的经济增长，中国最多也只会出现软着陆。

sentences.english: An autonomous optical navigation scheme for probes landing on small body is presented.
sentences.chinese: 提出了一种小天体软着陆自主导航与障碍检测方法。

definition: moon landing/to land on the moon
track (for trains etc)/orbit (of a satellite)/(fig.) a person's established path in life/desired trajectory (of a business or other endeavor)/(audio engineering) track/(quantum mechanics) orbital
